resources: Snakes, Fish & Bird // Layout (Select image to open gallery) (Press Image to see creator bio) Animal Race List Snakes Fish Birds Snakes Race List Fish Race List Birds Race List Study Program : Informatics Engineering Name : Arya Kusuma Class : TID NIM : 200602099 Hobbies: Playing games and basketball // Data Ular Anaconda United States of America The anaconda is a large group of snakes endemic to freshwater and rivers in tropical South America. viper Almost all over the country Vipers are a group of venomous snakes, family Viperidae. Cobra Africa and Asia The spoon snake or cobra is a special name for all types of venomous snakes that have the ability to flatten their necks to form a spoon or hood. Mamba Afrika Mamba is the general name for four species of deadly venomous snakes which are all classified as the genus Dendroaspis. Python Africa, Asia and Australia Python is a general term for all types of twisted snakes classified as the family Pythonidae. tycoon Australia and Papua Taipan is the name for three species of deadly Elapidae snakes which are all classified as the genus Oxyuranus. // Data Ikan Arwana Asia Asia Asian Arowana, or Red Siluk is a species of freshwater fish from Southeast Asia. Cupang Indonesia Betta splendens other than as an ornamental betta, betta splendens is a type of fighting, especially the old type. Ikan Mas Indonesia Carp or carp are freshwater fish that have important economic value and are widespread in Indonesia. Gupi North America Guppies, thousand fish, cere fish, or suwadakar, are one of the most popular freshwater ornamental fish species in the world. Whale Shark All Samudra The whale shark, Rhincodon typus, is a plankton-eating shark that is the largest fish species. Nemo United States of America The clownfish Ocellaris is a popular aquarium fish. This clown fish can be recognized by its orange color. // Data Burung Owl More in Greenland Birds are members of a group of vertebrate animals that have feathers and wings. Kolibri North and South America Hummingbirds are small, brightly colored birds that live mostly in North America and South America. Egret Asia Egret is a term for birds from the Ardeidae family. dove Many in various cities Pigeons and pigeons belong to the family Columbidae or pigeon-billed birds of the order Columbiformes, which includes about 300 species of songbirds. Penguin South Pole Penguins or penguins are aquatic animals that can not fly and generally live in the southern hemisphere. Potoo Central and South America Translated from English-Potoos is a group of Caprimulgiformes birds related to nightjars and frogmouths.
